intro: Galium capreum, commonly known as lesser bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium capreum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
